module.title: NIRCam module: A or B
module.description: Identifies the NIRCam module that was used (A or B).

channel.title: NIRCam channel: long or short
channel.description: Identifies the NIRCam channel (long or short). In each module a dichroic splits the incoming light into short (0.6-2.3um) and long (2.4-5.0um.) wavelength beams; the components associated with each of these beams are collectively referred to as a channel.

filter.title: Name of the filter element used
filter.description: Identifies the element of the filter wheel that was in the optical path for the exposure. Each channel (short, long) of each NIRCam module (A, B) is equipped with a filter wheel containing bandpass filters and weak lenses. Each filter wheel has 12 elements in it.
filter.calculation: query NrcMechanism (filtShortA, filtLongA, filtShortB, or filtLongB) based on MODULE and DETECTOR

pupil.title: Name of the pupil element used
pupil.description: Identifies the element of the pupil wheel that was in the optical path for the exposure. Each channel (short, long) of each NIRCam module (A, B) is equipped with a pupil wheel containing a mixture of bandpass filters, coronagraphic pupils, weak lenses, grisms, pinholes, and a flatfield/dark element. Each pupil wheel has 11 elements and 1 clear position.
pupil.calculation: query NrcMechanism (pupilShortA, pupilLongA, pupilShortB, or pupilLongB) based on MODULE and DETECTOR

pupil_imaging_lens.title: Pupil imaging lens in the optical path: T/F
pupil_imaging_lens.description: Identifies if a pupil imaging lens will to be used (T or F).
pupil_imaging_lens.calculation: query NrcMechanism (pilA or pilB) based on DETECTOR

bitpix.title: bits per data value
bitpix.description: The value field shall contain an integer that specifies the number of bits that represent a data value in the associated data array. BITPIX = 0 for the primary header. For the zeroframe image extension, 16 is uncalibrated and -32 is calibrated.

naxis.title: number of axes
naxis.description: The value field shall contain a non-negative integer no greater than 999, representing the number of axes in the associated data array. A value of zero signifies that no data follow the header in the HDU.  In the context of FITS 'TABLE' or 'BINTABLE' extensions, the value of NAXIS is always 2.

naxis1.title: Size of the axis
naxis1.description: The value field of this indexed keyword shall contain a non-negative integer, representing the number of elements along axis n of a data array.  The NAXISn must be present for all values n = 1,...,NAXIS, and for no other values of n. A value of zero for any of the NAXISn signifies that no data follow the header in the HDU. If NAXIS is equal to 0, there should not be any NAXISn keywords.

naxis2.title: Size of the axis
naxis2.description: The value field of this indexed keyword shall contain a non-negative integer, representing the number of elements along axis n of a data array.  The NAXISn must be present for all values n = 1,...,NAXIS, and for no other values of n. A value of zero for any of the NAXISn signifies that no data follow the header in the HDU. If NAXIS is equal to 0, there should not be any NAXISn keywords.

naxis3.title: Size of the axis
naxis3.description: The value field of this indexed keyword shall contain a non-negative integer, representing the number of elements along axis n of a data array.  The NAXISn must be present for all values n = 1,...,NAXIS, and for no other values of n. A value of zero for any of the NAXISn signifies that no data follow the header in the HDU. If NAXIS is equal to 0, there should not be any NAXISn keywords.

pcount.title: number of parameter bytes following data table
pcount.description: The value field shall contain an integer that shall be used in any way appropriate to define the data structure. In IMAGE extensions this keyword must have the value 0.

bscale.title: scale factor for array value to physical value
bscale.description: scale factor for array value to physical value

bzero.title: physical value for an array value of zero
bzero.description: physical value for an array value of zero

extname.title: name of extension containing zero frame data
extname.description: name of the extension containing zero frame data
